intro: Cestichis brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed cestichis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, commonly known as the palm family. This plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, clustered inflorescences. The leaves are typically narrow and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in tropical and subtropical gardens.
